verses.verse: (Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies) To the leader. A Psalm of David. (Job 13.24; Ps 44.24; 88.14) How long, O LORD? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?
(Ps 42.4, 9; 94.3) How long must I bear pain (Syr: Heb hold counsels) in my soul and have sorrow in my heart all day long? How long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
(Ezra 9.8; Ps 5.1; Jer 51.39) Consider and answer me, O LORD my God! Give light to my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death,
(Ps 25.2; Jer 20.10) and my enemy will say, “I have prevailed”; my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.
(Ps 9.14; 52.8) But I trusted in your steadfast love; my heart shall rejoice in your salvation.
(Ps 59.16; 116.7) I will sing to the LORD because he has dealt bountifully with me.
